Cache for images length onload

Cache the images.length value in a variable instead of recalculating on
each loop. Doesn’t make much difference in newer browsers but older
ones can see a large difference. See
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6973942/is-optimizing-javascript-for
-loops-really-necessary

possible to exclude image with 'data-no-retina'

Allow some images to not be processed by Retina

We had a very difficult to track down bug wherein Retina was setting the width and height of an image to 0px after an ng-show trigger. This should not be happening, and one easy fix is to allow individual images to not be processed by Retina.
Bump version
Bypass is_external check when data-at2x is provided

Simplify REGEX

No need to look for '?'.

Ensure the we are only modifying the path name when adding @2x.

If `document.createElement()` exists use that to create an 'a' element to
parse the URL otherwise simply assume the first '?' seperates the query
params from the rest of the URL (weak assumption).

Reguardless of method used, run regex replace on the path part only to
prevent @2x from being added to query params.

See added unit test for more info.
Version bump
Beef up the Makefile
Clean up README and move license into LICENSE file

Covers scenario where an exists on the page that doesn't have a src attribute. I ran into this on a single page app where there was an avatar img bound to a user's avatar url that hadn't been set yet. Even though this is arguably a bit of a weird case, it seems like it shouldn't break retina.js. Since it's an easy fix I decided to send a PR. Love this tool, very awesome. Thanks for sharing
add an option to choose the suffix for 2x images

Merge branch 'master' into sass

Added scss and sass partials

allow for default options to be set in one place.

included a function to manually set those options without changing the
source, but this is just useful for testing. tests are included.

Ultimately I think having to explicitly call a `new RetinaSwap( /*
options */ )` or `Retina.load( /* options */ )` is the way to go _if_
configuration is commonly needed, but that requires a larger change and
I'm not sure it is desired.

No matter what strategy is adopted, this may at least provide the
underlying functionality.

Stop double quoting path string in javascript eval, add spec

@path was being double quoted despite already being a string.
'string' became "'string'"
"string" became ""string"" which is a invalid javascript string.

Explicitly double quote the background image url.
Seems to be the convention generally.
